alert.note: Alert for Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 15 at 11:19AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...The Upper Chena River Upstream of the Moose Creek Dam * WHEN...Through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Rising water levels may go overbank in low lying areas on the Upper Chena River upstream of the Moose Creek Dam to Chena Hot Springs. River access points in the Chena River Recreation Area will likely be inundated with water. Gravel bars will be underwater, water will flow into the brush line along the river, and increased debris will be moving down the river * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Warm temperatures will continue to melt high elevation snowpack in the Chena River Basin. Runoff from snowmelt is causing river levels to gradually rise on the Upper Chena River and will continue this week. Water levels may climb above minor flood stage upstream of the Granite Tors Campground today. This crest of high water will gradually move down the Upper Chena River and reach the Moose Creek Dam on Wednesday. - Http://weather.gov/aprfc - Please stay tuned to NOAA weather radio or your favorite local weather news source for updates on this situation. - If you live near or along Upper Chena River upstream of the Moose Creek Dam stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
